VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {5} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Tidal relative to the peak of Solar in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Tidal is to the {right} of the peak of Solar.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Solar show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Solar shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Geothermal reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Hydroelectric} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =9.9?
EVJ.A: At X =9.9,the label with the highest density is {Hydroelectric}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 72? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 44? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Tidal}'s peak at {40},{Geothermal}'s peak at {9},{Hydroelectric}'s peak at {12},{Solar}'s peak at {11}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Hybrid Systems or Solar?
NC.A: {Hybrid Systems} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Hybrid Systems or Tidal?
NC.A: {Hybrid Systems} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Hydroelectric or Geothermal?
NC.A: {Hydroelectric} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {1} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Hydroelectric}
